document.discussion_title: 4 things we learned from the final 'X-Men: Apocalypse' trailer | KUTV
document.topic_text: tweet now! WASHINGTON (Sinclair Broadcast Group) — As the title and name of its lead villain imply, " X-Men: Apocalypse " is poised to be an epic battle for Earth's survival. That much has been clear since the project was announced and we got our first look at Apocalypse himself . But on Monday, 21st Century Fox and the film's director Bryan Singer continued to tease fans with the release of the flick's final trailer, giving us a little more perspective on the project that could give "Captain America: Civil War" a run for its money at the battle of the box office. Here's what we gathered from the final trailer for "X-Men: Apocalypse": A New Leader? Jennifer Lawrence's Mystique character appears to take on more of a leadership role after Professor X is "taken" by Apocalypse. "Taken" is the word used in the trailer after we clearly see Xavier get his butt kicked by an all-powerful Apocalypse. Rad Fights There is plenty of in-fighting between mutants, including what appears to be a cage match between Angel and Nightcrawler. Cyclops throws down with Storm. Psylocke tangos with Beast. Prof. X gets trounced by Apocalypse. You get the idea. Where's Hugh? Wolverine makes an appearance in this movie, although neither Hugh Jackman nor the character has been heavily featured at all in the build-up to May 27. Wolverine's claws get less than a second of screen time in the final trailer. Daddy Drama Quicksilver is Magneto's son officially. "X-Men: Days of Future Past" alluded to the relationship between the speedy mutant and his metal-attracting pops, but now it's spelled out in no uncertain terms. How this plays out in "Apocalypse" could be interesting considering Magneto goes full-on bad guy pledging his loyalty to "Apocalypse" as one of the Four Horsemen. component-story-more_media_horiz-v1-01
